content:
Yes, there are electric ferries being developed and in operation in various parts of the world. Electric ferries are considered a more environmentally friendly alternative to traditional diesel-powered ferries as they produce zero emissions and have lower operating costs. 

For example, in Norway, the world's first all-electric ferry, the "Ampere," has been in operation since 2015. It can travel up to 22 nautical miles on a single charge and has reduced carbon emissions by 95%. In Denmark, an all-electric ferry has been in operation since 2019 and can carry 30 cars and up to 200 passengers. 

Other countries, such as Finland and Canada, have also invested in electric ferries as part of their efforts to reduce carbon emissions and transition to more sustainable transportation.
